page.title: 08FARROWAY PUMPING STATION
page.content: We visited the pumping station called the{Farroway Depot.}It was built in 1948 and is owned by{Witham First {Internal Drainage Board,}Lincoln Division.The first pumping station was built in 1854 to drain the fenland into a man-made river called the{River {Skirth.}The original building is owned by{Anglian Water.}Water can now be pumped at the rate of 1200 litres per second from{Anwick Fen Drain}and {Ruskington Fen Drain.}Water can also flow freely from the Skirth back into the Farroway Drain which runs in between the other two. The pumps work automatically when the water reaches a certain level. The man who showed us round said his father and grandfather had worked at the station before he did.
